thread.title: Son of Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed pictured with Armed Forces in Yemen
thread.title_full: Son of Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed pictured with Armed Forces in Yemen | The National

author: Nadeem Hanif
title: Son of Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed pictured with Armed Forces in Yemen
text:
DUBAI // A photograph of Sheikh Theyab bin Mohammed bin Zayed on his tour of duty with the Armed Forces in Yemen has been posted on social media. 
The Instagram image shows Sheikh Theyab, the son of Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed, Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi and Deputy Supreme Commander of the Armed Forces, offering a bottle of water to a young child. 
He is dressed in military-issue clothing and appears to be in a residential home, with a sofa and a piece of wall art seen in the background.
The photo was posted by Salama bint Hamdan bin Mohammed, who posts on Instagram as elsadeem. 
Her caption reads: “We give thanks to God Almighty. I would like to thank all those who prayed for the safety of Theyab bin Mohammed. I assure you that he is safe alongside our other brave soldiers serving in Yemen.” 
The image emerged a week after Sheikh Mansoor bin Mohammed, the son of Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid, Vice President and Ruler of Dubai, posted pictures of his service in Yemen on his Instagram account . 
The images included one of Sheikh Mansoor holding a machine gun and was accompanied by a short poem defying the enemy and praising the Saudi-led coalition fighting for Yemen. 
Another photo showed him in front of the UAE flag next to other servicemen with the caption: “We thank Allah, by His grace, the Mareb dam was liberated and the historic Balqees Throne was purged from terrorists and Arab coalition flags hoisted.” 
There was a selfie of Sheikh Mansoor captioned with: “This is the historical Throne of Balqees reclaimed by Yemen after a battle with terrorists, whom occupied it previously by force” and the hashtag #selfieduringwar.
And a video, reported by one his followers, showed him saying: “Thank God we are here today in this beautiful area after great efforts from the men. You did well.”
nhanif@thenational.ae
